intro: Elephantopus mollis var. bracteosus, commonly known as the bracteled elephantopus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant features hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodland or along riverbanks. Its botanical structure supports its role in local ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
